page.title: 19BENENDEN WEALD, ROADS.
page.content: Two roads run from east to west across our block each with a different character. The B2086, Swattenden Road is a wide well-surfaced road in comparison to the narrow winding Nineveh Lane, weathered and sunken. The road runs mainly along the top of the hill only once dipping gently to cross a stream. The lane frequently drops steeply into valleys to cross small headstreams of the Rother. Old and new houses border the road with the landscape being generally open and fairly flat, and several services are here. The lane has a few farms, some of sandstone and there are no services along its length as it runs through a landscape of steep hills and woods with high hedges often almost meeting overhead. Traffic speeds along the road but has to advance slowly round the corners of the lane.
